revised_title: Artificial Selection and Female Guppy Mating Preferences
tldr: This study investigates the effect of artificial selection on male guppy color patterns and its impact on female mating preferences. Researchers found that female guppies tend to prefer males with more orange coloration. By imposing artificial selection for increased and decreased amounts of orange in male guppies, the study demonstrates a possible genetic correlation between female mating preference and male color patterns, which could contribute to the variation in color patterns and female preferences across guppy populations.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
